name: container_high_cpu_utilization
description: Container high CPU utilization is an incident type that occurs when a container's CPU utilization exceeds a certain threshold. It may indicate an issue with the containerized application or the container itself, and can potentially cause performance issues or even service downtime. This incident type requires immediate attention to identify the root cause and take necessary actions to prevent further impact.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Container High CPU Utilization
Container high CPU utilization is an incident type that occurs when a container's CPU utilization exceeds a certain threshold. It may indicate an issue with the containerized application or the container itself, and can potentially cause performance issues or even service downtime. This incident type requires immediate attention to identify the root cause and take necessary actions to prevent further impact.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Get the list of containers running on the instance

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `docker ps`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the CPU usage of a specific container

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `docker stats ${CONTAINER_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the CPU usage of the instance

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `top`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the CPU usage of all processes

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `ps aux`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check the CPU usage of a specific process

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `ps aux | grep ${PROCESS_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the memory usage of the instance

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `free -m`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the disk usage of the instance

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `df -h`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the system logs

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `dmesg`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check the logs of a specific container

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `docker logs ${CONTAINER_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## Check the logs of a specific process

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `journalctl -u ${PROCESS_NAME}`

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Check the network connections and status

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `netstat -tupan`

cells.name: cell_24
cells.content: ## Check the open files and their owners

cells.name: cell_25
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `lsof`

cells.name: cell_26
cells.content: ## The container has been assigned more CPU resources than it actually needs, leading to high utilization.

cells.name: cell_27
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_container_cpu_utilization($CPU_LIMIT, $CONTAINER_NAME)

cells.name: cell_28
cells.content: ## Adjust the container's CPU limits to better match its actual usage.

cells.name: cell_29
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_update_cpu_limits($CPU_LIMIT, $CONTAINER_NAME)
